newsitem.title: UK: Britain protests at closure of Croatian radio.
newsitem.headline: Britain protests at closure of Croatian radio.

text.p: Britain said on Thursday it was deeply concerned the Croatian government had failed to renew the licence of an independent radio station, saying this went against Croatia's promises to the international community.
The station affected is Radio 101, a mouthpiece for free speech when Croatia was part of former communist Yugoslavia.

"This step is inconsistent with Croatia's commitment to the international community to respect the freedom of its media, which was expressed most recently in connection with its accession to the Council of Europe," a Foreign Office spokesman said.
"We urge the Croatian authorities to reconsider the decision."
Thousands of people demonstrated in Zagreb on Wednesday to protest over the government's plan to award the radio's frequency to a rival station which does not yet exist.

The closure of the radio station has also prompted criticism in Austria, where a senior Austrian parliamentarian, Greens deputy Terezija Stoisits, warned Zagreb on Thursday it was treading a dangerous path away from a democratic Europe.
